alert.note: Alert for Clay; Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 8:44PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following counties, Clay and Duval. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and a thunderstorm in the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to half an inch are possible in the warned area and rainfall continues to taper off. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Orange Park, Bellair-Meadowbrook Terrace and Lakeside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
